DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicate the date on which the last QC calibration including SUV validation was performed on the scanner producing the images for the current exam.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The most recent act of checking or adjusting (by comparison with a standard) the accuracy of a digital Positron Emission Tomography (PET) device.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Positron Emission Tomography Scanner Device Component
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered.:An electronic device that generates a digital representation of an image for data input to a computer.

Concepts.definition: A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered.
An electronic device that generates a digital representation of an image for data input to a computer or a receiver designed to search for a signal within a specified frequency range.

Property.preferredDefinition: Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining.:The act of checking or adjusting (by comparison with a standard) the accuracy of a measuring instrument.

Concepts.definition: Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining.
The act of checking or adjusting (by comparison with a standard) the accuracy of a measuring instrument.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The place in time that any record of a medical imaging event whether physical or electronic  happens.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Time meaning: Like time, date, frequency, occurence,..etc

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Any record of a medical imaging event whether physical or electronic.:Event; something that happens at a given place and time.:a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: Any record of a medical imaging event whether physical or electronic.
Something that happens at a given place and time.
The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.
